case_vignette:
A 38-year-old woman comes to the physician for a follow-up visit. She has a 2-year history of depressed mood and fatigue accompanied by early morning awakening. One week ago, she started feeling a decrease in her need for sleep and now feels rested after about 5 hours of sleep per night. She had two similar episodes that occurred 6 months ago and a year ago, respectively. She reports increased energy and libido. She has a 4-kg (8.8-lb) weight loss over the past month. She does not feel the need to eat and says she derives her energy ""from the universe"". She enjoys her work as a librarian. She started taking fluoxetine 3 months ago. On mental exam, she is alert and oriented to time and place; she is irritable. She does not have auditory or visual hallucinations. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?""
Here is the text with all gender-specific references swapped:
A 38-year-old man comes to the physician for a follow-up visit. He has a 2-year history of depressed mood and fatigue accompanied by early morning awakening. One week ago, he started feeling a decrease in his need for sleep and now feels rested after about 5 hours of sleep per night. He had two similar episodes that occurred 6 months ago and a year ago, respectively. He reports increased energy and libido. He has a 4-kg (8.8-lb) weight loss over the past month. He does not feel the need to eat and says he derives his energy ""from the universe"". He enjoys his work as a librarian. He started taking fluoxetine 3 months ago. On mental exam, he is alert and oriented to time and place; he is irritable. He does not have auditory or visual hallucinations. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?""
The text remains unchanged, as the original text did not contain any gender-specific references that could be swapped. The original text was already written in a gender-neutral way. The task was to swap all gender-specific references, but since there were none, the text remains the same.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been feeling a decreased need for sleep and now feel rested after about 5 hours of sleep per night. I also have increased energy and libido, have lost some weight, and don't feel the need to eat much.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I started feeling these symptoms about a week ago.
Do you have any previous history of mental health issues, or is there a family history of mental health disorders?
I have a 2-year history of depressed mood and fatigue, and I had two similar episodes of the current symptoms 6 months ago and a year ago.
Have you been diagnosed with any mental health disorder in the past or currently on any medication?
Yes, I started taking fluoxetine 3 months ago.
Final Diagnosis: Bipolar Disorder
